title: Inside Line: Only Russia kick more than England - is this a problem or an effective plan?
text:
England’s reliance on the boot at Rugby World Cup 2019 should not have come as a surprise given their tactics in the build-up, especially since the arrival of John Mitchell as defence coach, and a few insightful interviews.

Eddie Jones’ go-to method is to build pressure and force errors. That style clearly suits humid, sweaty conditions in which passing skills seem excruciatingly difficult to execute. Wet-weather rugby under the sun is how Jones has labelled it.

Even so, it is still interesting to see how England’s approach measures up against the other 19 teams at the tournament. After three games, they have kicked 87 times. As far as kicks per match, only Russia are registering more. You imagine...
description: England’s reliance on the boot at Rugby World Cup 2019 should not have come as a surprise given their tactics in the build-up, especially since the arrival of John Mitchell as defence coach, and a few insightful interviews.
